document.masterDocTitle: Catalog of the subgenus Melanoconion of Culex (Diptera: Culicidae) for South America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Catalog of the subgenus Melanoconion of Culex (Diptera: Culicidae) for South America

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Lectotype
(Larval exuviae): Baton Rouge , Louisiana , United States ( NMNH ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution in South America :
Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, French Guiana, Republic of Paraguay, Peru, Republic of Suriname, Venezuela. Type locality: Baton Rouge, Louisiana , United States

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional comments: This species has been incriminated as potential enzootic vector of Eastern equine encephalitis virus (
Cupp et al . 2003
, 2004 ) and as a potential vector of West Nile virus (
Cupp et al . 2007
) in the southern region of North America .
Cohen et al . ( 2009 )
considered
Cx. erraticus
as a vector, both enzootic and epizootic, of Eastern equine encephalitis virus in southeastern United States given its opportunistic feeding patterns and its distribution.
